flights.table_description: Flight arrival and departure information for all terminals at the airport. Tracks real-time flight status, passenger counts, and airline operations.

columns.id: Primary key, auto-incrementing flight record identifier
columns.flight_number: Unique flight identifier (e.g., UA123, AA456). Format: airline code + number
columns.airport_code: 3-letter IATA airport code (e.g., SFO, LAX, JFK)
columns.terminal: Terminal identifier where flight arrives/departs (e.g., A, B, C, International)
columns.passenger_count: Number of passengers on the flight. Used for occupancy predictions
columns.airline: Full airline name (e.g., United Airlines, American Airlines)
columns.origin: Origin airport 3-letter IATA code where flight departed from
columns.destination: Destination airport 3-letter IATA code (should match airport_code for arrivals)
columns.created_at: Timestamp when flight record was created in the system

terminal_occupancy.table_description: Real-time passenger occupancy levels in each terminal. Tracks current count vs capacity to calculate occupancy percentage. Critical for janitorial scheduling and crowd management.

columns.id: Primary key, auto-incrementing occupancy record identifier
columns.airport_code: 3-letter IATA airport code (e.g., SFO, LAX, JFK)
columns.terminal: Terminal identifier (e.g., A, B, C, International)
columns.current_count: Current number of passengers in the terminal
columns.capacity: Maximum passenger capacity for the terminal
columns.occupancy_percent: Calculated as (current_count / capacity) * 100. Generated column, always up-to-date
columns.timestamp: When this occupancy measurement was recorded

weather.table_description: Current weather conditions at the airport. Affects janitorial operations (wet floors, increased foot traffic from rain) and flight delays.

columns.id: Primary key, auto-incrementing weather record identifier
columns.timestamp: When this weather reading was recorded

passenger_sentiment.table_description: Passenger mood and satisfaction levels measured through surveys, facial recognition, or feedback kiosks. Used to assess terminal atmosphere and service quality.

columns.id: Primary key, auto-incrementing sentiment record identifier
columns.terminal: Terminal identifier where sentiment was measured

staff.table_description: Airport staff roster including janitors, security, customer service. Tracks current availability and shift schedules for operational decisions.

columns.id: Primary key, auto-incrementing staff record identifier
columns.name: Full name of the staff member
columns.airport_code: 3-letter IATA airport code where staff is assigned
columns.terminal: Terminal assignment (can be 'ALL' for roaming staff)

staff_morale.table_description: Staff morale and fatigue levels tracked over time. Low morale or high fatigue affects productivity and may require workflow adjustments.

columns.id: Primary key, auto-incrementing morale record identifier
columns.staff_id: Foreign key to staff table, links to specific employee

robots.table_description: Autonomous cleaning robots (floor scrubbers, vacuum cleaners) deployed in terminals. Tracks battery levels, operational status, and maintenance schedules.

columns.id: Primary key, auto-incrementing robot record identifier
columns.airport_code: 3-letter IATA airport code where robot is deployed

zone_conditions.table_description: Real-time environmental conditions in specific terminal zones. Reports wet floors, spills, debris, or other conditions requiring cleaning attention.

columns.id: Primary key, auto-incrementing zone condition record identifier
columns.timestamp: When condition was reported or detected

zone_traffic.table_description: Foot traffic levels in specific terminal zones. High traffic areas require more frequent cleaning and may need robots instead of human janitors during peak times.

columns.id: Primary key, auto-incrementing zone traffic record identifier
columns.foot_count: Approximate number of people passing through in last measurement period

cleaning_log.table_description: Historical log of all cleaning activities. Tracks who cleaned what, when, and how long it took. Used to calculate time since last cleaning for scheduling.

columns.id: Primary key, auto-incrementing cleaning log record identifier
columns.cleaner_id: ID of staff or robot that performed cleaning (links to staff_id or robot_id)
columns.completed_at: When cleaning was completed. Used to calculate duration
columns.notes: Optional notes about cleaning (e.g., 'Spill cleaned', 'Deep clean performed')

occupancy_predictions.table_description: Predicted future occupancy levels for terminals. Generated by ML models based on flight schedules, historical patterns, and events. Used for proactive janitorial scheduling.

columns.id: Primary key, auto-incrementing prediction record identifier
columns.terminal: Terminal for which prediction is made
columns.prediction_time: Future timestamp that prediction is for (e.g., 1 hour from now)
columns.confidence: Prediction confidence score (0-1), where 1 is highest confidence
